data.description: A string .BED of .bam file path of data to be plotted, or a data frame in BED format, a character value,or a \link[GenomicRanges]{GRanges} object

chrom.description: A string specifying a chromosome of region to be plotted

chromstart.description: An integer start position on chromosome to be plotted

chromend.description: An integer end position on chromosome to be plotted

assembly.description: A string representing the default genome assembly or a\link[plotgardener]{assembly} object.Default value is \code{assembly = "hg38"}

fill.description: A character value, a vector, or a\link[plotgardener]{colorby} object specifying fill colors of range elements.Default value is \code{fill = "#7ecdbb"}

collapse.description: A logical value indicating whether to collapserange elements into a single row, or intotwo rows if \code{strandSplit = TRUE}.If \code{collapse = TRUE}, \code{boxHeight} will be ignored and elementswill be the height of the entire plot if \code{strandSplit = FALSE} orbe the height of half of the entire plot if \code{strandSplit = TRUE}.Default value is \code{collapse = FALSE}. Options include: TRUE, FALSE

boxHeight.description: A numeric or unit object specifying height of range elementboxes. Default value is \code{boxHeight = unit(2, "mm")}

spaceWidth.description: A numeric value specifying the width of minimum spacingbetween range element boxes, as a fraction of the plot's genomic range.Default value is \code{spaceWidth = 0.02}

spaceHeight.description: A numeric value specifying the height of spacing betweenrange element boxes on different rows, as a fraction of boxHeight.Default value is \code{spaceHeight = 0.3}

limitLabel.description: A logical value indicating whether to draw a "+"when not all elements can be plotted in the plotting space. Defaultvalue is \code{limitLabel = TRUE}. Options include: TRUE, FALSE

strandSplit.description: A logical value indicating whether plus andminus-stranded elements should be separated. Elements can only besplit by strand if a \code{strand} column is found in \code{data}.Default value is \code{strandSplit = FALSE}. Options include: TRUE, FALSE

bg.description: A character value indicating background color.Default value is \code{bg = NA}

baseline.description: A logical value indicating whether to include abaseline along the x-axis. Default value is \code{baseline = FALSE}. Options include: TRUE, FALSE

baseline.color.description: A string baseline color.Default value is \code{baseline.color = "grey"}

baseline.lwd.description: A numeric baseline line width.Default value is \code{baseline.lwd = 1}

x.description: A numeric or unit object specifying ranges plot x-location

y.description: A numeric, unit object, or character containing a "b"combined with a numeric value specifying ranges plot y-location.The character value willplace the ranges plot y relative to the bottom of the most recentlyplotted plot according to the units of the plotgardener page

width.description: A numeric or unit object specifying ranges plot width

height.description: A numeric or unit object specifying ranges plot height

just.description: A string specifying the justification of ranges plot relative to its (x, y) location.If there are two values, the first value specifies horizontaljustification and the second value specifies vertical justification.Possible string values are: \code{"left"}, \code{"right"},\code{"centre"}, \code{"center"}, \code{"bottom"}, and \code{"top"}.Default value is \code{just = c("left", "top")}. Options include: c("left", "top"), c("left", "bottom"), "left", c("right", "top"), c("right", "bottom"), "right", "top", "bottom", "center"

default.units.description: A string indicating the default units to useif \code{x}, \code{y}, \code{width}, or \code{height} are only givenas numerics. Default value is \code{default.units = "inches"}. Options include: "inches", "cm", "npc", "snpc", "native", "mm", "points"

draw.description: A logical value indicating whether graphics output shouldbe produced. Default value \code{draw = TRUE}. Options include: TRUE, FALSE

params.description: An optional \link[plotgardener]{pgParams} objectcontaining relevant function parameters

....description: Additional grid graphical parameters. See \link[grid]{gpar}.\end}}\value{Returns a \code{ranges} object containing relevantgenomic region, coloring data, placement, and \link[grid]{grob} information
